content.raw:
We considered addressing this as we merged forward but we were tight on time and decided to just leave it in.

We closed the `default` branch as there's no plan to release Gazebo 12.
content.html:
We considered addressing this as we merged forward but we were tight on time and decided to just leave it in.

We closed the default branch as there's no plan to release Gazebo 12.

content.raw:
Being consistent about the rules is good, I understand that… It’s just a pity this ugly hack has to be carried further…

Should I try to fix it up in master?
content.html:

content.raw: sorry the 11.0.0 tag was pushed yesterday #!/osrf/gazebo/commits/c1537db2c8550db2566a634fcee382a7ab6d7fbe
content.html: sorry the 11.0.0 tag was pushed yesterday #!/osrf/gazebo/commits/c1537db2c8550db2566a634fcee382a7ab6d7fbe

content.raw: Ah, I see that this PR was transplanted to Gazebo 11 even with the ABI-compatibility hacks that were only supposed to stay in 9 and 10. Is there still a chance of doing the ABI-incompatible changes in 11?
content.html: Ah, I see that this PR was transplanted to Gazebo 11 even with the ABI-compatibility hacks that were only supposed to stay in 9 and 10. Is there still a chance of doing the ABI-incompatible changes in 11?

content.raw: Thanks!
content.html: Thanks!

update.description:
Added support for flippers in the SimpleTrackedVehiclePlugin.

I’ve right away made it ABI-compatible with gazebo9 \(I needed to change the type of one of the member variables\). Now I really regret I haven’t PIMPLized even the “leaf” plugin classes, but just the TrackedVehiclePlugin common ancestor. The reviewers should be more strict about PIMPLizing new stuff :smiley:

The PR is structured so that if you cherry-pick everything except commits [91c6858](https://bitbucket.org/peci1/gazebo/commits/91c68584e02e75f1347a3b59872eaf9ce7eee7b9) and [d34bd4a](https://bitbucket.org/peci1/gazebo/commits/d34bd4a28dbbf7a9bb6fa97aa60f8b88b8b914e1?at=gazebo9), you get the nicer version without the ugly ABI-compatibility global variable.

The PR added options to mark links as either left/right flipper, which means these links will behave as if they were the main tracks in contact with terrain. Any kind of articulation of the flippers is left to the user using the standard joint controller mechanisms.
update.title: Tracked vehicles add flippers

content.raw: Ubuntu and Windows look good, and the tracked vehicle tests already passed on Homebrew. Merging!
content.html: Ubuntu and Windows look good, and the tracked vehicle tests already passed on Homebrew. Merging!

content.html: Triggered a round of CI since it looks like this PR hasn't been tested yet.

content.html: looks good to me, thanks!

content.raw: since gazebo 10 is also released, we also have to preserve ABI. So we’ll remove this variable when merging forward to 11
content.html: since gazebo 10 is also released, we also have to preserve ABI. So we’ll remove this variable when merging forward to 11

update.description:
Added support for flippers in the SimpleTrackedVehiclePlugin.

I’ve right away made it ABI-compatible with gazebo9 \(I needed to change the type of one of the member variables\). Now I really regret I haven’t PIMPLized even the “leaf” plugin classes, but just the TrackedVehiclePlugin common ancestor. The reviewers should be more strict about PIMPLizing new stuff :smiley:

The PR is structured so that if you cherry-pick everything except commits [91c6858](https://bitbucket.org/peci1/gazebo/commits/91c68584e02e75f1347a3b59872eaf9ce7eee7b9) and [d34bd4a](https://bitbucket.org/peci1/gazebo/commits/d34bd4a28dbbf7a9bb6fa97aa60f8b88b8b914e1?at=gazebo9), you get the nicer version without the ugly ABI-compatibility global variable.

The PR added options to mark links as either left/right flipper, which means these links will behave as if they were the main tracks in contact with terrain. Any kind of articulation of the flippers is left to the user using the standard joint controller mechanisms.
